Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of DUIs that Matt Gaetz has had, as there is evidence of only one DUI arrest.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that the DUI case against Matt Gaetz was dropped, implying that he was guilty when he was not.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support for the statement that Matt Gaetz's father got him off each time, as there is no evidence to support this.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Matt Gaetz was involved in the hospice fraud case, when in fact it was his father's former company that was involved.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider the alternative explanation that Matt Gaetz's DUI arrest was handled by a different prosecutor due to a conflict of interest.
